For example, it was found that the fixed combination of Eleutherococcus and Andrographis might be useful for the treatment of encephalitis because of the synergistic inhibition of the expression of a number of genes of the molecular network involved in the development of encephalitis, whereas neither Eleutherococcus nor Andrographis individually has an effect on these genes.
25 Although microarray analysis did not provide the final proof of the efficacy of this fixed combination in humans with encephalitis after its oral administration, it provided information regarding its predictable ( z‐score > 2) effects on diseases and biological functions as well as insights into putative genes and directions for future research and possible implementation into practice.
